1.name: The Third Man
1.description: Pulp novelist Holly Martins travels to shadowy, postwar Vienna, only to find himself investigating the mysterious death of an old friend, Harry Lime.

2.name: On the Town
2.description: Three sailors on a day of shore leave in New York City look for fun and romance before their twenty-four hours are up.

3.name: She Wore a Yellow Ribbon
3.description: Captain Nathan Brittles, on the eve of retirement, takes out a last patrol to stop an impending massive Indian attack. Encumbered by women who must be evacuated, Brittles finds his mission imperiled.

4.name: Kind Hearts and Coronets
4.description: A distant poor relative of the Duke of D'Ascoyne plots to inherit the title by murdering the eight other heirs who stand ahead of him in the line of succession.

5.name: The Fighting Kentuckian
5.description: In 1818 Alabama, French settlers are pitted against greedy land-grabber Blake Randolph but Kentucky militiaman John Breen, who's smitten with French gal Fleurette De Marchand, comes to the settlers' aid.

6.name: Samson and Delilah
6.description: When strongman Samson rejects the love of the beautiful Philistine woman Delilah, she seeks vengeance that brings horrible consequences they both regret.

7.name: John Loves Mary
7.description: A GI marries the English girlfriend of his best friend to get her into the U.S. for his friend who lost track of her in the war only to find on returning home that he is stuck with the girl because the friend has married someone else.

8.name: The Heiress
8.description: A young naive woman falls for a handsome young man who her emotionally abusive father suspects is a fortune hunter.

9.name: White Heat
9.description: A psychopathic criminal with a mother complex makes a daring break from prison and leads his old gang in a chemical plant payroll heist. Shortly after the plan takes place, events take a crazy turn.

10.name: Border Incident
10.description: Mexican and American federal agents tackle a vicious gang exploiting illegal farm workers in southern California.

11.name: Adam's Rib
11.description: Domestic and professional tensions mount when a husband and wife work as opposing lawyers in a case involving a woman who shot her husband.

12.name: Batman and Robin
12.description: The caped crusaders versus The Wizard, black-hooded mastermind.

13.name: The Secret Garden
13.description: A girl is sent to live with her uncle on his estate when her parents die. There she discovers much intrigue, family history and secrets and personal baggage. In particular, a screaming child and...a secret garden.

14.name: Little Women
14.description: A group of sisters experience life's difficulties and its pleasures while growing up in nineteenth-century America.

15.name: All the King's Men
15.description: The rise and fall of a corrupt politician, who makes his friends richer and retains power by dint of a populist appeal.

16.name: The Fountainhead
16.description: An uncompromising, visionary architect struggles to maintain his integrity and individualism despite personal, professional and economic pressures to conform to popular standards.

17.name: The Blue Lagoon
17.description: In the Victorian period, two children are shipwrecked on a tropical island in the South Pacific and fall in love while growing up together.

18.name: Act of Violence
18.description: An embittered, vengeful POW stalks his former commanding officer who betrayed his men's planned escape attempt from a Nazi prison camp.

19.name: D.O.A.
19.description: Frank Bigelow, told he's been poisoned and has only a few days to live, tries to find out who killed him and why.

20.name: Sands of Iwo Jima
20.description: A dramatization of the World War II Battle of Iwo Jima.

21.name: Twelve O'Clock High
21.description: A hard-as-nails general takes over a bomber unit suffering from low morale and whips them into fighting shape.

22.name: Late Spring
22.description: Noriko is twenty-seven years old and still living with her widowed father. Everybody tries to talk her into marrying, but Noriko wants to stay at home caring for her father.

23.name: Stray Dog
23.description: During a sweltering summer, a rookie homicide detective tries to track down his stolen Colt pistol.

24.name: Silent Dust
24.description: A wealthy blind man is determined to build a cricket pavilion as a memorial to his dead son, who was killed in battle in World War II. Not long before the dedication ceremony is to be held,...                See full summary »

25.name: Criss Cross
25.description: An armored truck driver and his lovely ex-wife conspire with a gang to have his own truck robbed on the route.

26.name: Battleground
26.description: True tale about a squad of the 101st Airborne Division coping with being trapped by the Nazis in the besieged city of Bastogne, Belgium during the Battle of the Bulge in December of 1944.

27.name: The Adventures of Ichabod and Mr. Toad
27.description: An animated adaptation of "The Wind in the Willows" followed by an adaptation of "The Legend of Sleepy Hollow".

28.name: A Letter to Three Wives
28.description: A letter is addressed to three wives from their "best friend" Addie Ross, announcing that she is running away with one of their husbands...but she does not say which one.

29.name: Too Late for Tears
29.description: Through a fluke circumstance a ruthless woman stumbles across a suitcase filled with $60,000, and she is determined to hold onto it even if it means murder.

30.name: Whisky Galore
30.description: Scottish islanders try to plunder 50,000 cases of whisky from a stranded ship.

31.name: Under Capricorn
31.description: A young gentleman goes to Australia where he reunites with his now married childhood sweetheart, only to find out she has become an alcoholic and harbors dark secrets.

32.name: Mighty Joe Young
32.description: A young woman who has raised a giant gorilla from an infant brings him to Hollywood years later seeking her fortune in order to save her family's ranch.

33.name: The Great Gatsby
33.description: A Jazz Age bootlegger learns the hard way about the wages of sin.

34.name: Impact
34.description: A unfaithful wife plots with her lover to kill her husband, but the lover is accidentally killed instead. The husband stays in hiding, and lets his wife be charged with conspiracy.

35.name: Pinky
35.description: A light-skinned black woman falls in love with a white doctor, though he is unaware of her true race.

36.name: Champion
36.description: Boxer Midge Kelly rises to fame...mainly by stepping on other people.

37.name: The Great Sinner
37.description: A young writer goes to Wiesbaden to write about gambling and gamblers, only to ultimately become a compulsive gambler himself. Losing all his wealth, as well as his moral fibre, he commits ...                See full summary »

38.name: Jour de Fête
38.description: Once a year the fair comes for one day to the little town 'Sainte-Severe-sur-Indre'. All inhabitants are scoffing at Francois, the postman, what he seems not to recognize. The rising of the...                See full summary »

39.name: The Passionate Friends
39.description: The Passionate Friends were in love when young, but separated, and she married an older man. Then Mary Justin meets Steven Stratton again and they have one last fling together in the Alps.

40.name: Knock on Any Door
40.description: An attorney defends a hoodlum of murder, using the oppressiveness of the slums to appeal to the court.

41.name: Love Happy
41.description: The Marx Brothers help young Broadway hopefuls while thwarting diamond thieves.

42.name: Passport to Pimlico
42.description: Residents of a part of London declare independence, when they discover an old treaty. This leads to the need for a 'Passport to Pimlico'.

43.name: Madame Bovary
43.description: A provincial doctor's wife's romantic illusions about life and social status lead her to betray her naive husband, take on lovers and run up ruinous debts.

44.name: Take Me Out to the Ball Game
44.description: Two turn-of-the-century baseball players, who work in vaudeville during the off-season, run into trouble with their team's new female owner and a gambler who doesn't want them to win the pennant.

45.name: The Inspector General
45.description: A town's corrupt officials think a fool is actually an investigator in disguise.

46.name: Reign of Terror
46.description: Robespierrre, a powerful figure in the French revolution, is desperately looking for his black book, a death list of those marked for the guillotine.

47.name: Le Silence de la Mer
47.description: 1941 in a small town in Nazi occupied France. Against the will of its elderly male and his adult niece residents, the Nazis commandeer a house for one of their officers, Lt. Werner von ...                See full summary »

48.name: Beyond the Forest
48.description: Resentful of her small-town life, a married woman schemes to run off with a rich businessman.

49.name: Scene of the Crime
49.description: Homicide detective Mike Conovan investigates the shooting of fellow detective Monigan...who apparrently was moonlighting as guard for a bookie. He finds that all the bookies in town are ...                See full summary »

50.name: In the Good Old Summertime
50.description: In turn-of-the century America, Andrew and Veronica are co-workers in a music shop who dislike one another during working hours but unwillingly carry on an anonymous romance through the mail.
